externalDocs.description: See documentation for Akamai's Prolexic IP Protect Configuration API

info.description:
Shield your site from DDoS attacks by diverting traffic and
scrubbing network packets.
info.title: Akamai: Prolexic IP Protect Configuration API

get.description: Returns IP address ranges for the Akamai Management IP  subnets. The Management IPs forward sanitized traffic from an Akamai scrubbing center to your network.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Prolexic IP Protect Configuration API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

items.description: IP addresses for the Akamai Management IPs.

get.description: Policy domain summary information including domain configurations and subnets.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Prolexic IP Protect Configuration API

parameters.description: Returns only the latest set of configuration values for the policy domain. Omit this parameter or set it to `false` to return all the available configuration value sets for the domain.
parameters.name: latest

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

configVersionId.description: Unique identifier for the configuration version.

createdBy.description: Username of the person responsible for creating the configuration.

createdTimestamp.description: ISO 8061 timestamp indicating the creation time for the configuration.

deployState.description: Current deployment state of the configuration version. The value `edited` indicates that changes have been made to policy domain, but that those changes haven't been deployed yet. `deploying` indicates that the configuration is in the midst of the deployment process, while `deployed` indicates that there are no outstanding changes that need deploying.

ipsAllocated.description: Total number of virtual IP addresses allocated to the policy domain.

ipsConfigured.description: Total number of virtual IP addresses configured for the policy domain.

legacyPdSubnet.description: Indicates whether Prolexic Proxy created the subnet.

items.description: Unique identifier of the virtual IP address.

updatedBy.description: Username of the person responsible for the most recent update of the configuration.

updatedTimestamp.description: ISO 8061 timestamp indicating the time of the most recent update for the configuration.

createdBy.description: Username of the person responsible for creating the policy domain.

createdTimestamp.description: ISO 8061 timestamp indicating the creation time of the policy domain.

pdId.description: Unique identifier of the policy domain.

policyDomainName.description: Unique name of the policy domain.

portsLimit.description: Maximum number of open TCP/UDP ports allowed on a single virtual IP address.

updatedBy.description: Username of the person responsible for the most recent update of the policy domain.

updatedTimestamp.description: ISO 8061 timestamp indicating the time of the most recent update to the policy domain.

vipsLimit.description: Total number of virtual IP addresses available to the policy domain.

post.description: Returns information about the specified virtual IP addresses. Include the IDs of those virtual IP addresses in the `vipIds` array in the request body.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Prolexic IP Protect Configuration API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

vipIds.description: Comma-delimited list of the unique identifiers of the virtual IP addresses to add.

schema.description: The virtual IP addresses that IP Protect uses to redirect Internet traffic.

akamaiFrontend.description: The Akamai virtual IP address that's been mapped to a back-end server or subnet.

createdBy.description: Username of the person responsible for allocating the virtual IP address.

createdTimestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the creation time of the virtual IP address.

customerBackend.description: IP address of a customer's server or subnet.

legacyVip.description: Indicates whether Prolexic Proxy created the virtual IP address.

pdSubnet.description: Virtual IP address of the subnet.

pdSubnetId.description: Unique identifier of the virtual IP subnet.

ports.description: Comma-delimited string of ports open to Internet traffic.

serviceType.description: The type of IP address or subnet service configured.

sourceIpProtocol.description: Specifies the source IP for network packets received at a customer's back-end server or subnet. By default, packets are set to `NA`, identifying Akamai as the source IP. Other source IP options are `NAT46`, `CIP`, `PROXY_PROTOCOL_V1`, `PROXY_PROTOCOL_V2`, and `OPTION_28`. `NAT46` is only available if the virtual IP address has an IPv4 address and the back-end IP has an IPv6 address. The remaining options require the virtual IP address to be running on a TCP network.

updatedBy.description: Username of the person responsible for the most recent update of the virtual IP address.

updatedTimestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the most recent update of the virtual IP address.

vipId.description: Unique identifier of the virtual IP address.

post.description: Returns the health status for the specified policy domains in UNIX epoch milliseconds. Akamai retains health statistics for seven days. \nList domain names in the `customers` array in the request body. You can also use `startTime` and `endTime` to define a health status time interval, beginning with the `startTime` and ending with the `endTime`. If you don't include `endTime` the time interval automatically extends to the current time.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Prolexic IP Protect Configuration API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

items.description: Unique identifier of the policy domain.

endTime.description: Timestamp in Unix epoch milliseconds of the latest set of health statistics to retrieve. If omitted, the health statistics interval automatically extends to the current time.

startTime.description: Timestamp in Unix epoch milliseconds of the earliest set of health statistics to retrieve. Akamai maintains health statistics for seven days.

items.description: Reports the health status of the back-end IP addresses in your policy domains.

policyDomainName.description: Unique name of the policy domain.

items.description: Virtual IP addresses. IP Protect routes traffic to these virtual IP addresses.

akamaiFrontEnd.description: The Akamai virtual IP address that's been mapped to a back-end server or subnet.

backendIps.description: IP addresses of a customer's servers and subnets.

items.description: IP addresses of a customer's servers and subnets.

backendIp.description: IP addresses of a customer's server or subnet.

status.description: Current state of the back-end IP. Either `healthy`, `possible_connectivity_issues`, `connectivity_issues`, `down`, or `unknown`. IP Protect calculates health status by determining the percentage of active locations for a back-end IP address.

customerBackend.description: IP address of the customer's server or subnet.

vipId.description: Unique identifier of the Akamai virtual IP address.

get.description: Returns summary information for the specified policy domain. Use the `extended` parameter to return information about the number of virtual IP addresses available to, and configured for, the domain.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Prolexic IP Protect Configuration API

parameters.description: Enables inclusion of `ipsAllocated` and `ipsConfigured` values in the query response. These parameters are omitted from the API response if you don't include `extended` or set its value to `false`.
parameters.name: extended

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

items.description: Virtual IP address allocations and configurations for the policy domain.

configVersionId.description: Unique identifier of the configuration version.

ipsAllocated.description: Number of virtual IP addresses allocated for the policy domain.

ipsConfigured.description: Number of virtual IP addresses configured for the policy domain.

createdBy.description: Username of the person responsible for creating the policy domain.

createdTimestamp.description: ISO 8061 timestamp indicating the creation time of the policy domain.

pdId.description: Unique identifier of the policy domain.

policyDomainName.description: Unique name of the policy domain.

portsLimit.description: Maximum number of TCP or UDP ports configurable on a single virtual IP address.

updatedBy.description: Username of the person responsible for the most-recent update of the policy domain.

updatedTimestamp.description: ISO 8061 timestamp indicating the most-recent update time of the policy domain.

vipsLimit.description: Number of virtual IP addresses available to the policy domain.

parameters.description: Unique name of the policy domain.
parameters.name: pdName

post.description: Adds new virtual IP addresses (VIPs) and creates or deletes subnets as needed for the specified policy domain. /nThe request body also requires the previously deployed configuration. Include the previous configuration's `pdSubnet`, `vips`, `vipId`, `customerBackend`, `akamaiFrontend`, `ports`, `sourceIpProtocol`, `probeType`, and `probePort` values to avoid the previous configuration being removed. To find the previous configuration, run [List policy configurations](https://techdocs.akamai.com/ip-protect/reference/get-policy-domains-pdname-configs).

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Prolexic IP Protect Configuration API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

legacyPdSubnet.description: Indicates whether Prolexic Proxy created the subnet.

pdSubnet.description: Virtual IP address of the subnet.

akamaiFrontend.description: Akamai virtualmIP address that's mapped to the back-end IP address.

customerBackend.description: IP address of a customer's server or subnet that's been mapped to the virtual IP address.

legacyVip.description: Indicates whether Prolexic Proxy created the virtual IP address.

ports.description: Comma-delimited string of virtual IP address ports open to Internet traffic.

sourceIpProtocol.description: Specifies the source IP for network packets received at a customer's back-end server or subnet. By default, packets are set to `NA`, identifying Akamai as the source IP. Other source IP options are `NAT46`, `CIP`, `PROXY_PROTOCOL_V1`, `PROXY_PROTOCOL_V2`, and `OPTION_28`. `NAT46` is only available if the VIP has an IPv4 address and the back-end IP server or subnet has an IPv6 address. The remaining options require the VIP to be running on a TCP network.

type.description: The type of IP address or subnet service configured.

createdBy.description: Username of the person responsible for creating the policy domain.

createdTimestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the creation time of the policy domain.

deployState.description: Current deployment state of the configuration version. The value `edited` indicates that changes have been made to policy domain, but that those changes haven't been deployed. `deploying` indicates that the configuration is in the midst of the deployment process, while `deployed` indicates that there are no outstanding changes that need deploying.

pdName.description: Unique name of the policy domain.

legacyPdSubnet.description: Indicates whether Prolexic Proxy created the subnet.

akamaiFrontend.description: IP address of an Akamai virtual IP address that's been mapped to a back-end IP.

customerBackend.description: IP address of a customer's server or subnet mapped to a virtual IP address.

legacyVip.description: Indicates whether Prolexic Proxy created the virtual IP address.

ports.description: Comma-delimited string of virtual IO address ports open to Internet traffic.

sourceIpProtocol.description: Specifies the source IP for network packets received at a customer's back-end server or subnet. By default, packets are set to `NA`, identifying Akamai as the source IP. Other source IP options are `NAT46`, `CIP`, `PROXY_PROTOCOL_V1`, `PROXY_PROTOCOL_V2`, and `OPTION_28`. `NAT46` is only available if the virtual IP address has an IPv4 address and the back-end IP has an IPv6 address. The remaining options require the virtual IP address to be running on a TCP network.

type.description: The type of IP address or subnet service configured.

vipId.description: Unique identifier of the virtual IP address.

updatedBy.description: Username of the person responsible for the most recent updating of the policy domain.

updatedTimestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the most recent update time for the policy domain.

get.description: Returns configuration information for the specified policy domain. By default, this operation returns all the available configuration sets. Use the `latest` parameter to return only the most recent set of configuration values.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Prolexic IP Protect Configuration API

parameters.description: Returns only the latest set of configuration values for the policy domain. Omit this parameter or set it to `false` to return all the available configuration value sets for the domain.
parameters.name: latest

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

configVersionId.description: Unique identifier of the configuration version. Higher values are more recent versions.

createdBy.description: Username of the person responsible for creating the configuration version.

createdTimestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the creation time for the configuration version.

deployState.description: The configuration version's current deployment state. The `edited` state indicates that changes have been made but haven't been deployed. `deploying` indicates that the config is in the deployment process, while `deployed` indicates that all changes have been deployed.

ipsAllocated.description: Total number of virtual IP addresses allocated for the policy domain.

ipsConfigured.description: Total number of virtual IP addresses configured for the policy domain.

configVersionId.description: Unique identifier of the configuration version.

legacyPdSubnet.description: Indicates whether Prolexic Proxy created the subnet.

pdSubnet.description: Virtual IP address of the subnet.

akamaiFrontend.description: The Akamai virtual IP address that's been mapped to a back-end server or subnet.

customerBackend.description: IP address of a customer's server or subnet that's been mapped to a virtual IP address.

legacyVip.description: Indicates whether Prolexic Proxy created the virtual IP address.

ports.description: Comma-delimited string of virtual IP address ports open to Internet traffic.

sourceIpProtocol.description: Specifies the source IP for network packets received at a customer's back-end server or subnet. By default, packets are set to `NA`, identifying Akamai as the source IP. Other source IP options are `NAT46`, `CIP`, `PROXY_PROTOCOL_V1`, `PROXY_PROTOCOL_V2`, and `OPTION_28`. `NAT46` is only available if the virtual IP address has an IPv4 address and the back-end IP has an IPv6 address. The remaining options require the virtual IP address to be running on a TCP network.

type.description: The type of IP address or subnet service configured.

vipId.description: Unique identifier of the virtual IP address.

updatedBy.description: Username of the person for the most recent update of the configuration version.

updatedTimestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the time of the most recent update of the configuration version.

parameters.description: Unique name of the policy domain.
parameters.name: pdName

put.description: Adds virtual IP addresses to the specified policy domain. In the request body, use `addVips` to specify the number of virtual IP addresses you're adding, and use `allocateIpv6` to configure the IP addressing type for these addresses. Set `allocateIpv6` to `true` to use IPv6 addressing, and either omit `allocateIpv6` or set the value to `false` to use IPv4 addressing.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Prolexic IP Protect Configuration API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

schema.description: Specifies the number and type of the IP addresses you want to allocate.

addVips.description: Number of virtual IP addresses to allocate.

allocateIpv6.description: Indicates that the new virtual IP addresses use IPv6 addressing. If you omit this parameter or set it to `false`, the new addresses use IPv4 addressing.

configVersionId.description: Unique identifier for the configuration version.

createdBy.description: User who created the configuration version.

createdTimestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the creation time of the configuration.

deployState.description: Current deployment state of the configuration version. The value `edited` indicates that changes have been made to policy domain, but haven't been deployed. `deploying` indicates that the configuration is in the midst of the deployment process, while `deployed` indicates that there are no outstanding changes that need deploying.

ipsAllocated.description: Number of virtual IP addresses assigned to the policy domain.

ipsConfigured.description: Number of virtual IP addresses configured for the policy domain.

pdName.description: Unique name of the policy domain.

legacyPdSubnet.description: Indicates whether Prolexic Proxy created the subnet.

akamaiFrontend.description: The Akamai virtual IP address that's been mapped to a back-end server or subnet.

customerBackend.description: The customer's server IP address or subnet that's been mapped to a virtual IP address.

legacyVip.description: Indicates whether Prolexic Proxy created the subnet.

ports.description: Virtual IP address ports open to traffic directed to a customer's website.

sourceIpProtocol.description: Specifies the source IP for network packets received at a customer's back-end server or subnet. By default, packets are set to `NA`, identifying Akamai as the source IP. Other source IP options are `NAT46`, `CIP`, `PROXY_PROTOCOL_V1`, `PROXY_PROTOCOL_V2`, and `OPTION_28`. `NAT46` is only available if the virtual IP address has an IPv4 address and the back-end IP has an IPv6 address. The remaining options require the virtual IP address to be running on a TCP network.

type.description: The type of IP address or subnet service configured.

vipId.description: Unique identifier of the virtual IP address.

updatedBy.description: User who most recent updated the configuration version.

updatedTimestamp.description: ISO 8061 timestamp indicating the time of the most recent update of the configuration version.

parameters.description: Unique name of the policy domain.
parameters.name: pdName

get.description: Returns the health status for the specified policy domain. Health status measures the percentage of locations currently availavle for a back-end IP address. IP Protect calculates separate health status scores for each back-end address.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Prolexic IP Protect Configuration API

parameters.description: Timestamp in Unix epoch milliseconds of the earliest set of health statistics you want to return. Akamai retains health statistics for seven days.
parameters.name: startTime

parameters.description: Timestamp in Unix epoch milliseconds of the latest set of health statistics you want to return. If omitted, the health status interval automatically extends to the current time.
parameters.name: endTime

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

policyDomainName.description: Unique name of the policy domain.

items.description: Virtual IP addresses. IP Protect routes traffic to these virtual IP addresses.

akamaiFrontEnd.description: The Akamai virtual IP address that's been mapped to a back-end server or subnet.

backendIps.description: IP addresses of a customer's servers and subnets.

items.description: IP addresses of a customer's servers and subnets.

backendIp.description: IP addresses of a customer's server or subnet.

status.description: Current state of the back-end IP. Either `healthy`, `possible_connectivity_issues`, `connectivity_issues`, `down`, or `unknown`. IP Protect calculates health status by determining the percentage of active locations for a back-end IP address.

customerBackend.description: IP address of the customer's server or subnet.
